titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Carol Bleier Research Files for "Tradition in Transition", 1901-2000 UA.90.29.12
titlestmt.author: Kara Jackman. Revisions occurred to the finding aid as a part of the encoding process on April 7, 2004.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:35:01 -0400.

did.unittitle: Carol Bleier Research Files for "Tradition in Transition"
did.abstract: Carol Bleier wrote a history of the School of Information Sciences in 2000. The book was called Tradition in Transition and it chronicled the years of 1901-2000, from when the library school began at Carnegie Institute of Technology to its current incarnation as a graduate school within the University of Pittsburgh. This collection documents the resources that Bleier used in writing the book which are photocopies of material from the Archives Service Center, 1901-2000.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: A freelance writer, researcher, and public relations specialist, Carol Bleier is the author of three books, which include: To Good Health and Life: L'Chaim: A History of Montefiore Hospital of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, 1898-1990 (co-written with Lu Donnelly and Samuel P. Granowitz); Ketchum Spirit: A History of Ketchum Communications Inc. (with Lu Donnelly); and her most recent publication, a history of the University of Pittsburgh's School of Information Sciences entitled, Tradition in Transition: A History of the School of Information Sciences, University of Pittsburgh: 100th Anniversary 1901--2001. Ms. Bleier has a master's degree from the School of Information Sciences, University of Pittsburgh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photocopied source materials for Tradition in Transition, a detailed history of the School of Information Sciences at the University of Pittsburgh, covering the first 100 years of the school. Though much of the material consists of photocopies from books, journals, newspapers, and primary source materials held by the University Archives, it is grouped together for the unique purpose of the writing of this book, providing an example of the process used and the research materials required to write an institutional history.

This collection contains four series. Series I. contains resource materials and research notes. Series II. contains faculty and alumni profiles and oral histories. Series III. contains Katz Graduate School of Business booklets and brochures. Series IV. contains School of Library and Information Sciences booklets and brochures.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on oral histories that do not have release forms.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the School of Information Sciences in 1999.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: This collection consists of photocopies of materials housed in many of the collections at the Archives Service Center, particularly University Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carol Bleier Research Files for "Tradition in Transition", 1901-2000, UA.90.29.12, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Kara Jackman in Spring 2004.

Revision and rearrangement for the encoded version of the finding aid provided by Kara Jackman in 2004. Information about the collection title and the controlled access terms was extracted from the MARC record in the University of Pittsburgh catalog Voyager ID number: 4304242

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

controlaccess.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. School of Information Sciences -- History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series I contains resource materials and author's notes. Many of the items within the folders are photocopies from original archival documents or published works. Some of the materials are original publications. The folder titles that begin at 1901-1929 and span to 2000, correspond directly with the chronological structure of Carol Bleier's book, Tradition in Transition. The folder titles include predominant dates and may also contain some undated material.

did.unittitle: School of Law - University of Pittsburgh

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series II contains profiles and oral histories. Profiles exist for all of the people listed below, as well as subject listings. However, there are only oral histories for some and are found in the same folder as the profiles material. The materials within each folder correspond to specific one page profiles in Carol Bleier's book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series III contains booklets and brochures created by the Katz Graduate School of Business. The Katz School and the School of Information Science have some classes that correspond so that students may cross-register.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains booklets and brochures created by the Library School and the School of Information Sciences.
